Class FESI.Data.ESValue 

FESI.Data.ESValue
public abstract class ESValue
All EcmaScript values are subclasses of this class. The ESValue support many operations which may not be implemented by all type (and then generate an error), to simplify type checking.

ESReference are currently not value - see ESReference.

EStypeBoolean
EStypeNull
EStypeNumber
EStypeObject
EStypeString
EStypeUndefined

ESValue()

booleanValue()
Return the boolean value of this ESValue as defined in 9.2, throw an exception if not defined.
callFunction(ESObject, ESValue[])
doConstruct(ESObject, ESValue[])
doubleValue()
Return the double value of this ESValue as defined in 9.3, throw an exception if not defined.
getAllDescriptions()
Return an enumeration of all description of elements of this value (for example properties of an object).
getDescription()
Returns a full description of the unnamed value.
getDescription(String)
Returns a full description of the value, with the specified name.
getTypeOf()
Return a code indicating the type of the object for the implementation of the "==" operator.
getTypeofString()
Return the name of the type of the object for the typeof operator
isBooleanValue()
Information routine to check if a value is a boolean if true, must implement booleanValue without a evaluator.
isComposite()
Return true if the value is composite (even if not an object).
isNumberValue()
Information routine to check if a value is a number (for array indexing) if true, must implement conversions to double and int without evaluator.
isPrimitive()
Return true if the value is a built-in primitive
isStringValue()
Information routine to check if a value is a string if true, must implement toString without a evaluator.
toDetailString()
Returns a detailed description of the value, intended for debugging.
toESBoolean()
Convert the value to an EcmaScript boolean (9.2) if possible
toESNumber()
Convert the value to an EcmaScript number (9.3) if possible
toESObject(Evaluator)
Return the EcmaScript object of this ESValue as definined in 9.9, throw an exception if not defined.
toESPrimitive()
Transform to a primitive as described in 9.1
toESPrimitive(int)
Transform to a primitive as described in 9.1, with a specified hint
toESString()
Convert the value to an EcmaScript string (9.8) if possible
toInt32()
Return the 32 bit integer, as defined in 9.5
toInteger()
Return the Integer value, as defined in 9.4.
toJavaObject()
Return a Java object which is the object to pass to Java routines called by FESI.
toUInt16()
Return the unsigned 16 bit integer (9.7).
toUInt32()
Returned the unsigned 32 bit integer (9.6).

EStypeUndefined 
 public static final int EStypeUndefined

 public static final int EStypeNull

 public static final int EStypeObject

ESValue 
 public ESValue()

toDetailString 
 public abstract String toDetailString()
Returns a detailed description of the value, intended for debugging. (toString returns the official string representation, as defined in 9.8).

Returns:
the detailled information
toJavaObject 
 public abstract Object toJavaObject()
Return a Java object which is the object to pass to Java routines called by FESI. This may be the corresponding Java object (for example the String), or a wrapper object. When received back from a Java routine, an equivallent (but probably not identical) object must be built.

Returns:
a Java object equivallent to the EcmaScript object.
doubleValue 
 public double doubleValue() throws EcmaScriptException
Return the double value of this ESValue as defined in 9.3, throw an exception if not defined.

Returns:
a double
Throws: EcmaScriptException
Thrown because by default this is not supported
booleanValue 
 public boolean booleanValue() throws EcmaScriptException
Return the boolean value of this ESValue as defined in 9.2, throw an exception if not defined.

Returns:
a boolean
Throws: EcmaScriptException
Thrown because by default this is not supported
toESObject 
 public ESValue toESObject(Evaluator evaluator) throws EcmaScriptException
Return the EcmaScript object of this ESValue as definined in 9.9, throw an exception if not defined.

Parameters:
evaluator - The evaluator object
Returns:
an ESObject
Throws: EcmaScriptException
Thrown because by default this is not supported
toInteger 
 public double toInteger() throws EcmaScriptException
Return the Integer value, as defined in 9.4.

Returns:
An integer inside a double
Throws: EcmaScriptException
Not thrown
toInt32 
 public int toInt32() throws EcmaScriptException
Return the 32 bit integer, as defined in 9.5

Returns:
The signed 32 bit integer
Throws: EcmaScriptException
Not thrown
toUInt32 
 public int toUInt32() throws EcmaScriptException
Returned the unsigned 32 bit integer (9.6). Currently implemented as toInt32 !

Returns:
The integer
Throws: EcmaScriptException
Not thrown
toUInt16 
 public short toUInt16() throws EcmaScriptException
Return the unsigned 16 bit integer (9.7). Currently ignore the sign issue.

Returns:
The unsigned as a short
Throws: EcmaScriptException
Not thrown
toESBoolean 
 public ESValue toESBoolean() throws EcmaScriptException
Convert the value to an EcmaScript boolean (9.2) if possible

Returns:
The EcmaScript boolean value
Throws: EcmaScriptException
Not thrown
toESString 
 public ESValue toESString()
Convert the value to an EcmaScript string (9.8) if possible

Returns:
The EcmaScript string value (there is always one!)
toESNumber 
 public ESValue toESNumber() throws EcmaScriptException
Convert the value to an EcmaScript number (9.3) if possible

Returns:
The EcmaScript number value
Throws: EcmaScriptException
From doubleValue
isPrimitive 
 public abstract boolean isPrimitive()
Return true if the value is a built-in primitive

Returns:
true if a primitive
toESPrimitive 
 public abstract ESValue toESPrimitive() throws EcmaScriptException
Transform to a primitive as described in 9.1

Returns:
A primitive value
Throws: EcmaScriptException
If conversion is impossible
toESPrimitive 
 public abstract ESValue toESPrimitive(int preferedType) throws EcmaScriptException
Transform to a primitive as described in 9.1, with a specified hint

Parameters:
preferedType - the prefered type to return
Returns:
a primitive value
Throws: EcmaScriptException
If conversion is impossible
callFunction 
 public ESValue callFunction(ESObject thisObject,
                             ESValue arguments[]) throws EcmaScriptException
doConstruct 
 public ESObject doConstruct(ESObject thisObject,
                             ESValue arguments[]) throws EcmaScriptException
isNumberValue 
 public boolean isNumberValue()
Information routine to check if a value is a number (for array indexing) if true, must implement conversions to double and int without evaluator.

Returns:
true if a number.
isStringValue 
 public boolean isStringValue()
Information routine to check if a value is a string if true, must implement toString without a evaluator.

Returns:
true if a String (ESString or StringPrototype).
isBooleanValue 
 public boolean isBooleanValue()
Information routine to check if a value is a boolean if true, must implement booleanValue without a evaluator.

Returns:
true if a boolean (ESBoolean or BooleanPrototype).
getTypeOf 
 public abstract int getTypeOf()
Return a code indicating the type of the object for the implementation of the "==" operator.

Returns:
A type code
getTypeofString 
 public abstract String getTypeofString()
Return the name of the type of the object for the typeof operator

Returns:
The name of the type as a String
isComposite 
 public abstract boolean isComposite()
Return true if the value is composite (even if not an object). A composite value can be examined by getAllDescriptions. A composite value may have no component!

Returns:
true if composite
getAllDescriptions 
 public Enumeration getAllDescriptions()
Return an enumeration of all description of elements of this value (for example properties of an object).

Returns:
Enumerator of all components or NULL.
getDescription 
 public abstract ValueDescription getDescription(String name)
Returns a full description of the value, with the specified name.

Parameters:
name - The name of the value to describe
Returns:
the description of this value
getDescription 
 public ValueDescription getDescription()
Returns a full description of the unnamed value.

Returns:
the description of this value
